lede: when I came out to them as asexual they disregarded my feelings
story_texts: My friends and family were always a safe place but when I came out to them as asexual they disregarded my feelings.; I told them I was ace and it was something that took me off guard too.  I never knew asexualilty existed or that there was a community of people who felt the way I do. ; I expected confused or shockness. I never expected them to be upset not that I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable coming out to them earlier‚Äîbut because I came out to them at all. ; I never felt more ashamed for being rejected by the people I trusted to have my back. It was hard to stand there and not lash out or burst into tears. Yet, I kept my emotions in check and tried to figure out why they reacted the way they did. ; I felt alone ; I felt so alone, so out of place in a house that used to be my save haven. I couldn‚Äôt turn to anyone because everyone I trusted the most was in that room so I left. I packed my shit up and didn‚Äôt look back. Being out in the open environment allowed me the chance to breathe as I figured out where to go next and what to do.

I am the youngest of four siblings. The fact that I was born three months premature, resulted in the diagnosis of Athetoid Spastic Cerebral palsy. Although I am highly independent, I have never been given the proper support to utilize my full capability, independence & potential. Thus, confining me to an electric wheelchair for mobility & caregivers doing everything for me. I have always felt that everyone has treated me like I am incompetent, despite my age. I was abused & neglected by my mother & middle brother for as long as I can remember until the age of eighteen. My mother was periodically absent from my life, because she was incarcerated multiple times throughout my elementary & middle school career for reasons that I still don‚Äôt know. It was during my elementary & high school career that two CPS & one APS case was filled against my mother which were all ruled unsubstantiated, due to the lack of physical evidence, even though my oldest brother & grandmother were aware of the treatment that I received & did nothing. Due to the lack of acceptance, affection, approval, comfort, compassion, grace & love from my family, it was also during my elementary & middle school career that I began having numerous incest relationships with female cousins & three female friends where I first began to question my sexuality, dressed like a tomboy & labeled myself as bisexual. Freshman year of high school these incest relationships ended & I began to get involved in numerous long distance relationships in desperation for acceptance, affection, approval, comfort, compassion, grace & love while avoiding altercations, arguments, confrontations & disagreements because of my trauma. When these relationships did not last, I got involved in six different in person relationships where I was extremely indecisive as to whether or not I should be with these individuals, because of the paralyzing fear of my past repeating itself which prevented any of those relationships from lasting. Although I was extremely adamant about setting myself apart from my family dynamic, alcohol, premarital intercourse & Marijuana is the norm in my family. Therefore, I was persistently pressured to try Marijuana until I finally gave into trying Marijuana once I graduated from high school just to shut my family up. I used Marijuana inconsistently recreationally for awhile. At the age of eighteen, I was finally removed from my mothers home when I experienced suicidal ideations for the very first time & my significant other whom I was with at the time called the authorities asking them to do a welfare check on me. I was placed at my local hospital under an alias until alternative placement was found. Two weeks later, I was taken to my first nursing home where I resided for three months. While there, I ended my relationship with my significant other at the time & transitioned to a group home only staying two weeks because I had slowly started reconnecting with my family on social media & became homesick. Instantly after returning home, I realized that their behavior had not changed, but I had no way to return to the nursing home or group home. Therefore, I remained at home & attempted my first semester in college. While attending college, I befriended one female who was fully aware of my home life. Her & I decided to get an apartment together in attempt to get away from my family. While she remained in college, I dropped out the same semester that I went in, because my home life at the time prevented me from maintaining a reasonable GPA. At this point, I had given up on love & was not looking for a relationship. However, I still had an account with multiple online dating apps. While scrolling through an app one evening, I received a message from a man who was new to my area & homeless after leaving an abusive relationship & attempting to start fresh with another female who he soon found out was not interested in a serious relationship. Him & I spoke for one month on Kik & Facebook Messenger before meeting in person. The more that we got to know one another, he soon became my significant other, I took him off of the street & my roommate moved out. At this time, I was continuing to use marijuana recreationally, but inconsistently. Within a year & a half of our relationship, I lost my virginity to him conceiving our first born son. I stopped using marijuana during my pregnancy & I had a healthy uneventful pregnancy. However, despite our efforts to be as prepared as possible for his arrival with numerous ultrasounds doctors were not prepared for the difference in anatomy when removing my son from my womb. Thus causing me to contract the Sepsis virus & remain hospitalized for twenty eight days while my son was discharged from the hospital accordingly two days after his arrival. We only had our son home for two weeks before a CPS case was opened up against my ex boyfriend on Valentines Day. My ex boyfriend was allegedly accused of emotional & physical abuse as well as unsupervsion of an infant when he expressed that he saw himself throwing my son when he became overwhelmed, but never actually did to a registered nurse who was associated with the Families First Program. During the investigation, my ex boyfriend & I were required to get Psychiatric Evaluations & Counseling Services that later confirmed our diagnoses of Anxiety, Chronic Depression & PTSD allowing me to get my Medical Cannabis License. When I attempted to discuss the results of my psychiatric evaluation with my mother, she stated that my family thinks that I fabricated the story as to how I obtained my mental health illnesses. During this time, my ex boyfriend was told that he was the father of a female child conceived during the two month relationship with the abusive female that caused him to leave his hometown & become homeless. He was ordered to pay child support for & visit her monthly. However, because of his mental health  illnesses that are the result of his upbringing & the incident with our son he was not able to pay child support or visit her. Gratefully, although the child support is court ordered the aunt of his ex girlfriend who has custody of his daughter does not want any type of financial support. All she wanted was for the child to have a relationship with her father, so we began to visit her monthly. My son was transitioned to four different people before my sister was given custody & the case was closed. During this time, my mother was evicted from her apartment due to non payment of rent since she was attempting to support my brothers alcoholism. I agreed to take both of them in under the agreement that no alcohol be consumed under my roof which I learned later was not followed. While my mother & brother were living with me, my mother consistently pressured me into purchasing marijuana for my brother with my license which I did in an attempt to avoid upsetting anyone. Although I had good intentions, housing my mother & brother kept me in a constant trigger continuously reacting. Thus, causing my ex boyfriend & I to break up leading him to leave back to El Paso. However, we continued to communicate during that time & agreed that the reason for the decline in our mental health & relationship was because of the dysfunctional relationship with my family & he agreed to continue working on our relationship as long as I kicked my brother & mother out of my house. One evening while my mother was at my grandmothers & I was left at home with my brother talking to my ex boyfriend on the phone my brother who was intoxicated demanded to use my phone & I said no. He proceeded to take my phone from me while emotionally & verbally abusing me. When I attempted to walk away, my brother blocked the door. While attempting to defend myself from the emotional & verbal abuse of my brother. He forcefully pushed my back into the backrest of my wheelchair causing redness on my chest. My ex boyfriend who was on the other end of the phone during the whole ordeal called the police from El Paso. The police arrested my brother that night, due a warrant that was out for his arrest for failure to pay fines. When my mother finally came home at 6:00 AM the next morning, I told my mother that if she bailed my brother out, that would indicate to me that my brother & his alcoholism would be more important than my safety & well-being which would lead to me never speaking to neither of them again. Although my mother repeatedly apologized for my brothers behavior & promised me that she would not bail him out. My mother bailed my brother out the very next day. After picking up my ex boyfriend from El Paso, I kicked my mother & brother out of my house. At this point, I was consistently attending weekly counseling services. However, after a year & a half of Counseling Services, I stopped attending Counseling, because of all of the bureaucracy within this world. Upon searching for a silver lining in my circumstances, hardships & obstacles I visited two different churches before finding my forever home & family with Real Life Church in my hometown where I was baptized for the very first time. However, despite my efforts to mend our five year relationship our relationship was unquestionably unhealthy which resulted in me leaving my hometown & church behind in order to reside in a second nursing home where I have lived for six months hoping that my ex boyfriend & I  could individually & as couple be restored since we were given the support to solely focus on our relationship rather than attempting to balance a coworker & significant other relationship at the same time. However, since I left he had to return to a normal job which he uses as an excuse to not visit his children & as much capability & potential that I felt our relationship had it unfortunately did not turn out the way that I had hoped permanently ending on Wednesday October 23 2019. As dark as a nursing home may seem or as difficult as it may be for someone my age to be living in a nursing home, I feel that I was brought here to be used as a vessel of Christ as Romans 8:28 states ‚ÄúAll things work together for the good of those who love God & are called according to his purpose‚Äù which has allowed me to remain grateful for every aspect of my testimony that God is continuing to write on my heart, because I am a firm believer in the fact that God works through others & I know that without every aspect of my testimony I would not have found someone who acts as my family more than my biological family within the facility. I am now trying to find myself. ; I become attracted to anyone who gives me authentic genuine attention. I am attracted to the personality of others. ; I was laying down in bed when realizing that my body was reacting. ; Nothing. ; I don‚Äôt see nor do I want to see my best friend as anything other than my best friend, but I will get intrusive Scenarios about us being together when this happens I will get turned on. ; Weird

story_texts: I feel really judged when I share my experiences and people invalidate my feelings.; I recently shared an experience I had as a person of color ; and was told that it was fake by the person I shared with.; I had to justify my position in a way I shouldn‚Äôt have had to.; This has made me more cognizant of the ways that I respond to others sharing their vulnerabilities.; I will try in the future to be very affirming of others when they choose to open up to me.

lede: I'm pretty sure I get a lot of looks when I go out to other places with my family.
story_texts: I was born with a genetic condition which basically makes my vision extremely bad. It's so bad that I have to use a cane whenever I go to school or any other public place. Because of this, instead of someone seeing me and going "Hey, there's a girl there! She looks cool!" they think "Oh wow, a blind girl!" I know that it's not my fault, and they're not trying to be mean when they do it. But what they don't seem to get is that besides my vision, I'm pretty normal for the most tarp.; There are lots of other things I have to do differently because of my condition, too. I can't read print, I need to use braille. Special teachers come to my school every day to help me learn. And of course I can't use my iPhone to write this the way you do. I'm using voiceover, a setting that uses text to speech and special gestures. I can do just about anything you would, a lot of apps don't work for me but I've found several good ones that do. But like I said before, I can't see them but I know I'm getting a lot of funny looks because of all this. I think my school is pretty used to me by now, but I'm pretty sure I get a lot of looks when I go out to other places with my family.; Now that I'm in high school, I've started getting used to it. But I remember when I was younger it happened all the time. My mom wanted me to get as much experience in life as possible, so she took me to every park in the general area. Kids would come up to me and try to show me things or ask me to play, but when Mom explained my condition, they all treated me as if I were some kind of alien. I wish I was an alien, then I could fly through space and have all kinds of adventures LOL!; Like I said before I know they're not trying to make me feel this way. The kids at the parks for example, they were so young they probably didn't even know that not being able to see was a thing. That doesn't mean I don't wish they could have treated me a bit more normally.; A lot of the time, I don't even think about my condition. I feel like a normal girl. Then, somebody asks me if I like their sweater, and it all comes rushing back.; I've found ways of avoiding some of it all together, though. Whenever I talk to a new person, I try to start with something that we both understand that doesn't have anything to do with my condition. If we're at lunch for example, I'll ask what they're eating and what their favorite foods are. If we're in the library I'll try to start up a convo about the best and worst books we've ever read..

lede: I didn‚Äôt want to risk ruining our friendship by telling him how I felt
story_texts: When I am attracted to someone, especially someone I know, like, and respect, I often fear what might happen if I tell them. ; What if they rejected me? Could we still be friends? What if they were also attracted to me? Would our hangouts become dates? Would we then make out or have sex? How would that affect our relationship amd friendship? ; Recently, I felt attracted to one of my classmates. I knew he was also gay, but we were friends and I didn‚Äôt want to risk ruining our friendship by telling him how I felt. ; One day, he spoke first and said he had felt attracted to me. We did hook up, but I felt weird about it afterward and we decided to be friends again. ; It isn‚Äôt always that easy, and sometimes I worry that I acted weirdly or made him feel weird about it, ; but it helped me build confidence that I can express my attraction to people, even if they are friends, and experience a positive outcome.

lede: I was with a group of friends at the beach near our school
story_texts: I was with a group of friends at the beach near our school. ; We‚Äôd just finished having a picnic lunch and were laying in the sand until it was time for us to head back to school. ; I asked my friend if it would be alright for me to put my head in her lap.; She apologized and told me that she would prefer if I didn‚Äôt.; I wasn‚Äôt expecting her to say no, so I was surprised, but I was fine with it. I asked her a question and she answered me honestly.; I said ok and continued laying like I‚Äôd been doing before.

lede: I know my gender identity is male not because I want to be male but because I am
story_texts: I feel really judged when my mom sends me articles about people who detranstioned as I‚Äôve told her multiple times that I am a trans man and that while I understand that gender expression does not equal identity, I know my gender identity is male not because I want to be male but because I am, even if my chromosomes wouldn‚Äôt lead you to believe it. I know she thinks she‚Äôs helping me avoid a mistake of transitioning since I was pretty girly as a child but I know that now I feel happy when people use he/him and disgusted when I see my birthname or see my unbound chest or flat crotch or am reminded that I‚Äôll never be able to be a dad in the normal sense. I want her to know that I‚Äôve tried so hard to be a girl and be ‚Äònormal‚Äô but since socially transitioning, I have been actually able to imagine a future that doesn‚Äôt end with me dead at 20.; This has been happening for over a year and everyone else in my life seems to accept me expect the people I need to the most ; They say they‚Äôll love me no matter what but it doesn‚Äôt feel that way ; They want me to have an easy life but i can if they‚Äôll accept me ; I feel trapped ; My future can set me free but the present can‚Äôt

We were just texting.; I asked if they wanted to come over to my house, so it isn‚Äôt exactly consent but the invitation had some pretense. ; They said they were tired and were going to bed instead.; I felt rejected because I had put myself out there to try to hang out with this person and they didn‚Äôt want to hang out with me. It also made me feel like they didn‚Äôt want to hook up with me again. I started questioning whether I said/did something wrong or whether I was gross or weird or something. ; I‚Äôm still reacting. I felt sad about it, but I thought about how I can‚Äôt let one person‚Äôs decision not to hang out with me on one night determine my self worth.

lede: I think she‚Äôs worried that I will get discouraged/distracted
story_texts: My mother judged me when I told her that I was dropping a class that was on my premed track. I had to drop the class because it was no longer good for my mental health. I felt like I didn‚Äôt have time to breathe. She thought it was me giving up on my goals In life. She didn‚Äôt go to college so she doesn‚Äôt really understand how everything works. I had my brother explain it to her and now things are better. ; It made me feel like I was disappointing her but after conversing with my brother and father I realized that there are things that won‚Äôt align with other people‚Äôs goals for me and at the end of the day I need to do what is best for me at that point in time.  ; I felt like I was being judged because she legitimately told me that I was making a mistake and giving up.; Looking back I think she‚Äôs worried that I will get discouraged/distracted because she didn‚Äôt end up going to school and she really just wants the best for me. Since she doesn‚Äôt understand the school system I think she thinks this would put me behind or something. ; I felt hurt. I don‚Äôt like feeling like I‚Äôm failing people or disappointing them. ; Talking to my other family made me feel better. And not having to cry over that midterm made me feel extraordinary.
link_title: Why do I fight with my parents so much?

lede: The first time this happened, I kissed him.
story_texts: When I am attracted to someone, I have no problem acting on those feelings, especially now that I have a steady boyfriend. story_texts: She was one my friends from high school. ; When I first told her about my anxiety, she told me that I was ‚Äúlucky‚Äù to have an ‚Äúexcuse‚Äù about feeling anxious. ; While I might not have been judged directly, I felt that what she had said really dismissed anybody suffering from a mental illness and made me less likely to speak about it again. ; Though it wasn‚Äôt about me, I think she probably held commonly-believed myths and stigmas surrounding mental illness ; I felt embarrassed, judged, and silenced.; I simply tried to forget about it

I felt confused and rejected ; She eventually ended up telling me that she wanted to kiss me but was very nervous because she hadn‚Äôt kissed anyone before ; I felt relieved when she shared that reason and tried my best to make her feel comfortable with the fact that she was nervous ; I told her that it was ok that she was nervous and we didn‚Äôt need to kiss if she didn‚Äôt want to

I appreciated the way that he said no but it still made me sad to know that my feelings weren‚Äôt being reciprocated. ; I thanked him for being honest with me but I didn‚Äôt really wanna hang out after that so I went home pretty soon after.

story_texts: I felt judged by my friends when I didn‚Äôt do well on a test. ; We were all taking a test in a class I was really struggling with. ; They made me feel bad for not understanding the material. ; They thought they were better than me and smarter than me because they understood the material. ; It made me feel sad because I know I am smart but they were making me feel like I wasn‚Äôt. ; After I talked to some of my other friends about it, they helped me with the class

lede: I was really sad and couldn‚Äôt get out of bed to go to class
story_texts: I felt really judged when my dad made me feel like my mental health problems weren‚Äôt valid reasons for my poor academic performance; I wasn‚Äôt doing well in school because I was really sad and couldn‚Äôt get out of bed to go to class.; It felt like every time I talked to him about how sad I was he told me that everyone goes through things ; and that I should be able to go on with my daily life regardless.; I‚Äôm not sure; I felt really upset and alone; Talking to my friends and finding outside support helped me feel better.

lede: I felt like trash in the moment
story_texts: The person that judged me was a close friend of mine in college. ; Essentially, I always felt really judged by her when it come to my access to certain resources and my ability to do certain things. She made me question myself and if people genuinely liked me for me or if people were just around me because they had to be. ; The way in which she spoke to me, particularly her tone and the feelings of condescendion is what made me think I was being judged. ; I think she felt this way about me because she has more privileges than me. ; I felt like trash in the moment. ; What made me feel better was knowing my worth and that someone looking down on me from their place of supposed privilege doesn‚Äôt mean I am lesser than.

lede: The people that I think judge me are my friends.
story_texts: The people that I think judge me are my friends. ; I am 13 years old and still haven‚Äôt gotten my period when all of my friends have. I also haven‚Äôt gotten a boyfriend when all of my friends have. I feel different and judged. I am also white when all of my friends are either mixed, Mexican, or black. They judge me for being white and I feel so different from them. I always feel insecure around them too. I think that they feel like I am annoying and innocent and small when I‚Äôm just trying to be heard.; My friends sometimes make me feel like they don‚Äôt like me by never giving me any attention or including me in anything. They also never give me hugs willingly which sounds silly but I love hugs. ; I think they feel this way about me because I‚Äôm different from them. ; It‚Äôs wasn‚Äôt just one time either, it‚Äôs all the time.; I have a separate friend group from them. They make me feel accepted and loved even though I‚Äôm younger then them. I can‚Äôt even just drop my other friends because those friends go to my school and the nicer friends don‚Äôt. If I don‚Äôt have my school friends I will feel even more lonely and depressed and even more of a loser.

lede: I am attracted to my best friend and I really don‚Äôt think he feels the same way.
story_texts: I am attracted to my best friend and I really don‚Äôt think he feels the same way.; He always knows how to make me smile, I love his looks, his personality, and just everything about him. We like each other‚Äôs families, and we have so much in common.; I‚Äôve known him for so long that it has just been my secret for a long time.; None of my friends know and I have trust issues so I feel like I can never tell them.; He just makes me smile and gives me butterflies whenever we touch. I always act crazy around him and his smile is contagious.; I feel like I love him but he doesn‚Äôt love me back in that way. He is also older then me and is very shy so that contributes to why I think this way.

Literally there was this boy I knew that i tried to be best friends with. ; He was gorgeous and funny and the perfect boyfriend ever. Except he had a girlfriend. I slowly became obsessed with him and would never leave his side.; His girlfriend would be so jealous to the point of physically abusing him. He started agreeing with her and talking about me behind my back! ; I realized how dangerous my obsession has become, thinking we were best friends so I can evolve to turn into his girlfriend. My love for him was toxic and I had to get over him. title: First panic attack
lede: I was having my first ever panic attack
story_texts: I was having my first ever panic attack, in eighth grade...it was so nerve wracking, I couldn‚Äôt even speak.; Kids around me started calling me names, saying I was a crazy bitch for crying in class, and shaking and not being able to control myself. Kids shoved my in the halls, calling me the girl who cries...; I don‚Äôt think they understood what I was going through. It‚Äôs not fair that someone that is hurting so much just gets more hate in their life. I mean, eighth graders probably didn‚Äôt even know what was happening, but I knew it wasn‚Äôt right...or my fault.; I felt hurt. I felt like the whole world was crashing around me. How could kids be so ruthless? I honestly didn‚Äôt know what to do with myself.; Eventually a teacher noticed what was going on, and sent me to guidance. I met one of the most amazing people ever, my guidance counselor. For the rest of the year, he was the only person that could get me to calm down...the only person who could get me to talk, and feel better.; So many people judged me that day... but one person surprised me the most. My best friend. He just laughed among all of the other kids. It was like a stab in my little girl heart. The one person I relied on the help me in the situation. And even they abandoned me. We aren‚Äôt friends anymore... he called me crazy and decided he didn‚Äôt want to deal with my crap anymore. Guess it‚Äôs for the best.

title: Thin enough
lede: I felt really judged when a couple of girls from my old school used to say I wasn‚Äôt thin enough
story_texts: I felt really judged when a couple of girls from my old school used to say I wasn‚Äôt thin enough. However, I was a bit less than the average weight. I just didn‚Äôt realize this yet. This led to me watching carefully what I was eating and me kind of over obsessing the mirror. I mostly felt insecure about my body type. For example, if I wore a pair of nice jeans, I got several looks from those girls I mentioned. Once in awhile , a few boys and girls in my class would engage in a conversation of whose the thinnest. They would brag and criticize other people. I actually once caught a conversation about me. They had pure looks of disgust and were shaking their heads when one girl asked how thin they think I am. When I got home, I started crying. This wasn‚Äôt the only thing I got bullied for. They used to say I was weak. To this day, I admit I still have a problem with my appearance.; Those kids would whisper constantly and stare at you like you were a pitiful creature. ; Maybe they had nothing else better to do, but gossip? Or they were also insecure about themselves, so they decided to pick on people?; I felt a mixture of anger and embarrassment in myself for some reason. I would‚Äòve cried if I wasn‚Äôt in the public eye.; My best friend got me through the ‚Äúyear of terror‚Äù. She was getting physically injured once in a blue moon and verbally hurt. For example, she got pushed against a gate and had to get braces because she almost cracked her tooth. Also, my mom and dad were very sympathetic! My mom decided to move me that following year to a new school.; I don‚Äôt want to say their names, but they were a group of children. You see, my class was quite small, and most of them got their share of bullying me and two other girls (my best friend and another friend ). My relationship to them is very complicated. I avoid them as much as possible, but everybody seems to have a connection with them! I know I can‚Äôt just run away from my problems so, I ignore them. The problem is, my other best friend transferred to that school and she is hanging out with them. She says she doesn‚Äôt like them, but still hangs out with them. I know she‚Äôs doing this to feel included since it‚Äôs a very small class.

title: Toxic
lede: The first relationship I had was very very toxic
story_texts: The first relationship I had was very very toxic. I was 13 when it first started. She was a nerd and so was I, I met her through my best friend at the time. We were talking just as friends for awhile but then one day we started roleplaying... it got steamy fast and being so young and just starting puberty I was overwhelmed. My parents had just gotten a divorce and I wanted attention. Through doing role play that made me uncomfortable I got my attention. After awhile we started dating. Kissed in real life. Things were good I didn‚Äôt see a problem at the time. Well things started to get bad my freshman year of high school. ; Whenever I didn‚Äôt want to role play or simply was busy. She‚Äôd block me and talk sh*t about me to a group chat I was in on purpose. Then when I got upset about it she‚Äôd have a mental breakdown. It was so stressful and terrifying I didn‚Äôt know how to cope so I stayed in the relationship because I didn‚Äôt know what else to do. ; I ended up escaping the relationship by finally telling my friends what was going on. ; They supported me and reassured me that what she was doing was wrong and abusive. With their help I was able to breakup with her and block her on everything. She didn‚Äôt end up hurting herself or dying and I‚Äôm free now. I‚Äôm still scarred but I‚Äôm working on moving past my fears and working towards a healthy relationship with myself and eventually another person.; But I‚Äôm still working on that because right after I broke up with her I jumped into another toxic relationship in a different way. Moral of the story is to take your time after you break up with somebody. Boy does it hurt but you need time to heal and be content with yourself. You can‚Äôt depend on other people to make you happy.

title: Grandmas
lede: Then randomly she asked ‚Äúis the girl who slept over last night your girlfriend?‚Äù
story_texts: I was sitting on the couch with my grandma. Then randomly she asked ‚Äúis the girl who slept over last night your girlfriend?‚Äù In the meanest judgiest tone. I was taken aback trying to defend myself because she wasn‚Äôt. Ever since my grandma found out I was bisexual she has been dead set on driving me away from girls as much as possible. ; Whenever she brings up me being in a relationship she always has to add, ‚Äúboyfriend OR girlfriend‚Äù in the most sarcastic tone. Like she‚Äôs trying to be supportive but actually trying to belittle me for her having to try. ; She probably feels this way because of her generation. I understand her ignorance so I‚Äôm able to move forward. But I wish she could too. ; In the moment though I feel awful my heart hurts and I feel sick and embarrassed. ; I‚Äôm able to make myself feel better my realizing it‚Äôs MY life. I need to live it the way I want to even if some people don‚Äôt approve. It‚Äôs my opinion that matters the most. ; I love my grandma but I‚Äôm not going to let her control my life.

When I was in 5th grade, I really liked this new guy that came to my school. ; Over the course of the next few weeks I noticed that he kept glancing at me and my best friend. ;  So one day at lunch I asked him why he kept looking at us and he told me he liked MY BEST FRIEND!!!!! So a few minutes later, I went up to my best friend, touched her on the shoulder and asked ‚ÄúDo you like the new kid?‚Äù ; She said no. Then I asked ‚ÄúYou can tell me anything you know. We have been best friends since pre school.‚Äù Then she said, ‚Äúok. I do like him.‚Äù ; My heart sunk to the floor. Both of them told me to not tell the other person. I told them anyways that the person of their dreams liked them. ; I was heartbroken but I felt happy for my best friend thinking about the fact that nobody has ever liked her before. I decided that my best friend should be with him because I new that there was no point in going after a guy that likes someone else. ; To this day, I am currently in high school with my best friend still my best friend laughing over this event in my head. She doesn‚Äôt know about this and is still together with him.

title: Getting sexual
lede: When I was 14, my boyfriend asked me if we could try getting sexual
story_texts: When I was 14, my boyfriend asked me if we could try getting sexual. I told him that I‚Äôd have to think about it. I told my older sister, who told me that my virginity is an important thing. And I had to choose wisely. After two weeks, I told him, yes. But we had to ask our parents about it first, and get protection. So after asking our parents, we both got protection and a month later, we had sex for the first time. It hurt a lot. But it felt so good. We couldn‚Äôt get enough of each other. We would have sex three or four times a month. Once I had a little scare, but nothing happened. It just showed us to take extra care of our bodies and take the pill and use the condoms.; We asked our parents and went to our doctor for help and advice.; We both are protected.; My boyfriend doesn‚Äôt like the condom, but he knows I won‚Äôt do it without it.; We are too young to get pregnant, he wants to be a judge, and i want to be a teacher. title: Follower
lede: He followed me down the street to my house
story_texts: I knew this guy, and we had almost all of our classes together. It was clear that he had a crush on me, but I was just friends with him. We live in the same neighborhood. ; One day, I got off the bus to walk to my house, and he walked just behind me down the street. At first, I didn‚Äôt think anything was wrong. After all, he lived there too. ; But then we walked past his house. I knew it was his because I‚Äôd seen him the front yard during one of my runs. He followed me down the street to my house. He stood in the street and watched as I entered my house, and then he left. ; After that, he e-mailed me every day. I saw him everywhere I went; every class at school and every after school activity. It was awful. I guess he was kind of a stalker. But then the next year we didn‚Äôt have any classes together. ; I was so relieved. One night, I was coming home from a Swim Team social event with one of my friends (who is a guy). We stopped to pick up his brother and his friend, and guess who got in the car? The guy who had been following me. I was sitting next to my guy friend though, and only talked to him. ; My follower assumed we were dating, and later sent me an email saying we were a cute couple. I didn‚Äôt correct him because he finally left me alone. My friend was also okay with it, as long as the guy following me was the only one that thought so. Now, things are okay, but I still see him sometimes. He emailed me just the other day saying if I got tired of my ‚Äúboyfriend‚Äù that he was still available.

title: If I stayed
lede: I started to think the relationship was unhealthy when he started acting different towards me.
story_texts: I thought I had a healthy relationship with my ex boyfriend. I started to realize that it was unhealthy when he started to get mad over every little thing.; When we first started dating it was like the hone moon phase. We were all over each other and we were in love.; I started to think the relationship was unhealthy when he started acting different towards me.; He always tried to come at every little thing I did. I think if I stayed in that relationship it would have became abusive.; I was heartbroken because I thought he loved me, but over time those feelings changed.; I ended up breaking up with him because I couldn‚Äôt take it anymore.

title: First relationship
lede: Wherever I fell short, he excelled, and whenever he needed help, I‚Äôd step in
story_texts: He was my best friend. We were children together. ; I knew him almost as well as I knew myself, and he knew me just as well. Wherever I fell short, he excelled, and whenever he needed help, I‚Äôd step in.We weren‚Äôt very similar, but that made it better. We complemented the other.; I liked him and he liked me. It was as simple as that. We started wanting different things after the discovery of our feelings for the other. He was manipulative without meaning to be. That was when I started thinking; Oh boy, shit‚Äôs going to hit the fan.; On the surface level, nothing bad. He planned dates, surprised me often, and bought me gifts. I never wanted any of these things, though. Dates got in the way of my schedule, surprises made me anxious, especially ones in the forms of grand gestures, and I refused gifts out of principle. So he‚Äôd guilt trip me. He made me feel bad about not making time for dates. For not enjoying surprises like others do. For refusing gifts. He did things I didn‚Äôt enjoy. Things that made me uncomfortable.; I stopped seeing him. I used to allot an hour a day to drop by his house, to greet his family, and to study for a while before attending to my responsibilities. When he tried stretching that time, when he tried forcing me to stay and ‚Äòenjoy‚Äô his company, I stopped. I was uncomfortable, so I stopped putting myself in that situation.; I knew him, and he knew me. I‚Äôm not sure if either of us know each other anymore. We stopped talking for a year. We talked again for 4 months and 2 weeks through daily phone calls, as I am now in another country, and now we haven‚Äôt spoken in 2 months. I said ‚Äòbye‚Äô to him, and I suppose to the relationship we had as well. I still hear about him from my friends, and his friends have relayed messages of ‚Äòmake sure to eat,‚Äô and ‚Äòdon‚Äôt stress out,‚Äô from time to time .I‚Äôve been scouting for dates for him. He enjoys being in relationships with others, he feels happy, so I‚Äôve been aiding him there. We haven‚Äôt spoken to each other in 2 months. We‚Äôre distant, now. We‚Äôre still trying to help the other, I think. It‚Äôs strange. Our relationship is strange.

title: Sleepover period
lede: My friend told me to tell someone to ask if they had extra shorts. I got kinda nervous
story_texts: I was 11 when I started my period ; I was at a sleepover with a lot of my friends, to be more specific, my soccer team. We were down in my basement in the game/hangout area; I remember feeling like I really had to pee but I didn't want to go to the bathroom because we were having a lot of fun. We were laughing a lot so i thought that was all. I did remember that my stomach kinda hurt a little but we had just eaten so I thought I ate a lot. I was wearing white shorts because we were all matching. I remember my best friend on the team pulled me to the side and goes "dude go to the bathroom" i asked her why and she pushed me into it and followed behind me. I looked in the mirror and kinda panicked but i wasn't upset ; My friend told me to tell someone to ask if they had extra shorts. I got kinda nervous so I went upstairs and forced my bestie to go with me. I went to my best friends mom (i meant to say my friends house up there^) and pulled her off to the side away from my besties dad and one of his friends. She thought something was wrong and immediately asked if we were ok. i turned around and she got so happy but was worried that i was scared. I told her I was fine and she brought me and my bestie (her daughter) into the bathroom. Then all she did was took my shorts and underwear and put them in the the washer and had my friend get me some new ones to borrow. She handed me a pad and I put it on and when i came out she gave me a heat pack that she had just heated up and i put it under my shirt and we went back down and acted like nothing happened.; My best friend obviously knew first but we told her mom cause she was the only adult there.

title: All these new changes

title: My dad doesn't understand me
lede: Every time I bring up the fact of being gay to my dad, he goes into a lecture about how I‚Äôm too young to understand how I feel
story_texts: Every time I bring up the fact of being gay to my dad, he goes into a lecture about how I‚Äôm too young to understand how I feel, so my feelings towards men are invalid.; Every time I bring my boyfriend home to eat dinner with us, watch a movie with me, or just hang out, he tells us both that our relationship isn‚Äôt real simply because it‚Äôs two males.; While on the other hand, my little brother is trans and gay, and my dad believes all of his relationships are valid because he has a vagina; Whenever I ask him about it, he claims that a ‚Äúreal man‚Äù will teach his ‚Äúdaughter‚Äù to be girlier, and if I would just get myself a girl to date, I‚Äôd realise that I was wrong all along. He doesn‚Äôt respect our feelings and opinions, and it‚Äôs difficult to deal with at times.
link_title: Info and Resources for LGBTQ Teens and Allies

title: It didn't feel right
lede: That was my first kiss, and it felt absolutely weird. I didn‚Äôt like it, I mean I could stand it and it wasn‚Äôt unbearable, but I felt absolutely nothing.
story_texts: I went out with this boy and something felt really wrong about it. So I just sat in the car for a bit, then he came out to my car and asked if I was okay. I said yes, not wanting him to worry. So he got in the car and said ‚ÄúI know something that will make you feel better.‚Äù; He pulled me on top of him and started to kiss me. That was my first kiss, and it felt absolutely weird. I didn‚Äôt like it, I mean I could stand it and it wasn‚Äôt unbearable, but I felt absolutely nothing. He said ‚Äúso I don‚Äôt know my boundaries with you‚Äù and I said ‚Äúall clothes on, that‚Äôs my only request.‚Äù He started kissing me on my neck and chest and I felt nothing at all.; I said I felt sick and wanted to go home... once I got home, I knew I made a terrible mistake. I don‚Äôt even know why I let him do that, and it was just an overall terrible experience. I started to talk to other people about it, and they suggested maybe I didn‚Äôt like him or maybe he wasn‚Äôt right for me.; Those suggestions did not feel right at all. Then I started thinking about the moment in my car and it all clicked. My mind was spinning from the facts that had recently been realized. I only watch the female during a kissing scene in tv shows, I asked my mom when I was like 10 if I could marry girls or if it had to be just boys. I also even fangirled over all the badass girl superheroines, instead of liking Superman and Batman and Captain America like my friends and mom did.; I also didn‚Äôt like Jensen Ackles or Jared Padalecki in Supernatural, but instead loved the girl who played Charlie. After this realization, I started watching YouTube videos with gay people in them and also watching supergirl. (I know, I‚Äôm such a cliche haha.) I‚Äôve recently noticed everything my mind was scared to before.; The only problem was that everyone was talking about me. How I‚Äôm such a heartbreaker and that I don‚Äôt deserve to have anyone because I‚Äôd just hurt them even more than I did with the boy. They were talking about how I‚Äôm a slut and only use people to be sexual. They made my life hell for at least a month... I want so badly to tell them ‚ÄúI‚Äôm like so gay dude...‚Äù like KStew said on SNL, but I just can‚Äôt. Not yet.

title: Femme and butch

I‚Äôve stopped shaving my body hair, and it makes me feel normal and not in some sort of disguise. After reading about gender identity, I realized I didn‚Äôt want to dress like a cis girl because I wasn‚Äôt one.; I identify as a nonbinary/genderqueer person/woman who uses the pronouns she/her, but I don‚Äôt care about labels, and if we lived in a genderless society, I‚Äôd be very comfortable.; I have short hair, no makeup, a hairy bod, and I don‚Äôt wear dresses. title: Figuring it out
lede: Some nights it would keep me up for hours trying to determine the difference between how I really felt and how I was raised I should be
story_texts: For some back ground: I am a 15 year old female at birth, gender queer at the moment. Before this happened I had always questioned my sexuality, some nights it would keep me up for hours trying to determine the difference between how I really felt and how I was raised I should be. I never could figure it out and still I‚Äôm questioning some things; Just a few months ago I was hanging out with one of my friends, I knew she is lesbian and attractive but never thought I was sexually attracted to her. She is older so we drove to her friends appartment to hang out; We ended up, all three, wrestling each other. The other friend went to go to the bathroom but we kept wrestling, when she got over me I felt my heart race faster and all sweaty, she was looking good. In the next moment she leaned in and kissed me... and I kissed back!; I was so surprised with myself and scared that when I realized what I was doing I pushed her away. We looked at each other stunned, I could tell she felt really bad but surprised I kissed back; Her friend came back and didn‚Äôt know anything happened but as I sat there I could feel my vagina had a heart beat and my ears were tingly; Later on the ride home we talked about it and although my denial I knew in my mind that was all me and I was gay. Not one other incounter with men had made me feel the same and other thoughts had begun to come together... it all made sense. It was just that in the moment a feeling that had been deep down for a long time came through.

title: Changing statuses
lede: I ended up blocking her, but i forgot to block her iMessage, so she texted me and asked why I blocked her
story_texts: I was homeschooled most of my life until this year (8th grade). I have social anxiety, and not knowing anyone there was intimidating. I met a girl and we started talking and realized we had a lot in common. She invited me to eat lunch with her and even gave me her pack of Oreos.; Over time I realized I had feelings for her. I asked her out and she said yes. In that moment everything felt so perfect. She seemed to care about me, and I loved her more than anything. We only dated for a short time until she told me her mom wasn‚Äôt going to allow her to date until high school. We agreed to stay close and date when our freshman year came; I ended up going to the hospital and needing to leave school. We were still talking, but when I asked her if we could get together, she always said she was busy. We stopped talking as frequently, but I never stopped caring. Just yesterday, I saw she had posted a picture on instagram of her girlfriend - her NEW girlfriend who she had decided not to tell me about, and all this time I thought she still cared; As if that wasn‚Äôt bad enough, her mom had commented saying they were ‚Äúcute‚Äù. She lied to me about her mom saying she couldn‚Äôt date just so she wouldn‚Äôt have to break up with me. I ended up blocking her, but i forgot to block her iMessage, so she texted me and asked why I blocked her. I lied and told her I had blocked a bunch of people just because i had too many followers; She responded saying she was actually thinking about asking me to go do something with her this week. I know that is a lie because every time i ask her if she is mad at me she answers with the same thing. I unblocked her so I could still see her Instagram if i wanted to; She said she wasn‚Äôt mad (i still was but i was pretending not to be). We said goodnight and went to sleep. I woke up today to find she had blocked me on Instagram and iMessage. I trusted her and cared about her for so long, but I guess she never felt the same about me.

title: Anxiety in the end
lede: He ended up breaking up with me after 3 months, because I was so awful to him sometimes. I had thought I could be better for him than his previous girlfriend, but I didn't know how bad my anxiety would get
story_texts: During my Freshman year of high school, I had a crush on one of my close friends. The problem was that he had a girlfriend. They were on again off again, and she treated him like trash. I found myself trying to be there for him a lot, but it was hard to be supportive of the relationship when I liked him so much and she was so obviously not doing him any good. Nonetheless, I had to be, because I'm a good friend and I would never make a move on someone who's taken; Eventually, they broke up for good, and my other friends jumped at the chance to set us up. About 2 months after they broke up, him and 2 of my other friends had a sleepover at my house. We all went out to a park nearby around midnight and sat on an awning above the pond, listening to music and goofing off. He put his arms around me, and it made me feel amazing. Later that night, we all fell asleep in my living room, him and I cuddling on the couch; The next morning, he helped me make breakfast, and asked me to be his girlfriend. I was so excited, and he made me so happy. Not only had he been a great friend, but he had been proving himself to be great boyfriend material ever since he found out I liked him. He helped me cook, listened to my babbling, did the dishes without being asked despite being a guest in my house. We had the same sense of humor, liked doing a lot of the same things. After we became official, he would hang out at my house a lot and we would do homework together, watch TV, etc. ; One day, we sat in my room, organizing my bookshelf, and he asked me to tell him about all my favorite books. He found a picture of a dog that I used as a bookmark, and asked about her- my first best canine friend. Another time, he took the last aussie bite (a weird oatmeal snack that tastes awesome) and ran off, and I chased him all over my apartment complex until we collapsed on the ground laughing. I had an asthma attack, and he ran to my house to get my inhaler, then insisted on carrying me back home because I "still sounded wheezy"; Once, I said I hadn't had breakfast or lunch, and he went into panic mode and started looking through my kitchen for something to feed me. I remember sitting in his lap when a friend of my brother's made some inappropriate comment and he held me closer and told the person to screw off. There were other times like this, where someone was being innappropriate, and he knew it bothered me so he would put the person in their place; A kid once straight up asked if we had had sex yet, and I made some flippant comment about making him wait, and he looked me straight in the eyes and told me that he was fine with waiting as long as I needed. Eventually though, my anxiety got in the way and I ruined everything. I pushed away the guy that looked at me like I was his whole world, that called me beautiful despite the cringey haircut I had, who loved my affinity for animals, and who never, ever pushed me to do anything I wasn't comfortable with; He ended up breaking up with me after 3 months, because I was so awful to him sometimes. I had thought I could be better for him than his previous girlfriend, but I didn't know how bad my anxiety would get, that I would hurt him too. For a long time, I was able to convince myself that I was okay with the break up. Now, two years later, I can't seem to get him off my mind. But I don't want to hurt him again- I can't  try to drag him back in. It would be selfish.

title: Setting ground rules
lede: I told him no a few times but he kept trying to make moves.
story_texts: My boyfriend of two years and I were just hanging out on the couch at my place. My parents weren‚Äôt home at the time so we could just do whatever we wanted.; I honestly just was not in the mood to do anything sexual he really wanted to. I told him no a few times but he kept trying to make moves.; After that day, I was a little nervous around him and I just didn‚Äôt expect him to be like that. It took a few days of me being petty and I honestly was considering breaking up with him but I confronted him about it.; He was more mad at himself than anything I‚Äôm pretty sure. He genuinely felt awful about it and we talked it out. We set a few ground rules and all was well.; I‚Äôm glad he reacted the way he did. If he had taken the situation any other way I probably would have broken up with him. He accepted what he did was not okay and genuinely tried to make up for it. I loved him and still do.; It was important for me to say no at this time because he needed to take how I was feeling and know to stop. He didn‚Äôt and it got me mad but I didn‚Äôt give up on him. I was confused at first but then he held my hand and I blurted out "yes I'll go out with you and I've liked you since 6th grade!!"; Then we started dating and we were both EXTREMELY happy. So don't be scared to tell your crush you like them, because maybe they like you too

title: He wasn't actually interested
lede: I was afraid to tell him I had feelings so what better way than to make a vague post on my spam account
story_texts: 4-14-2018. That was the day that the illusion faded. I was in love with this boy from my school named Jordan. He was tall blond and beautiful; I wasn‚Äôt sure if he was gay or not but everyone said he was so I went for it. I started a streak with Jordan. He was all for it. I was so excited like Jordan was wanting to start being friends with me; After a month or two we became closer. It was nice. So I was afraid to tell him I had feelings so what better way than to make a vague post on my spam account; So after having it on there for two weeks he texted me. ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs your post about?‚Äù Being a complete wuss I said ‚Äúno one and particular.‚Äù And I asked why he was curious. No answer.; After asking him for three days he finally said ‚Äúidk because I thought it was about me and it was kinda weird...‚Äù My heart shattered into a million pieces. ‚ÄúNo Jordan, I can assure you it wasn‚Äôt about you just who I see myself with.‚Äù; How could he do this to me. How could my friends say go for it when he wouldn‚Äôt be interested in me. ; From there I had a period of time where I was diagnosed with depression and was almost put in medication. But I wouldn‚Äôt let them put me on meds. Instead I went and talked to close friends and teachers about this. I cried a lot. But I‚Äôm better now.

Other boys in my class didn't act that way. ; So after 1 month of these dares getting harsher and harsher I finally told my teacher. She stopped it but after she stopped it j still felt like I was being used. Like I was just a doll. Like I was just a part of their twisted little game; So I sent an email to my teacher and we talked the next day. She helped me a lot through it and I'm so thankful for her. üòÉ

title: The best night
lede: That night at the reception I saw this guy that sat near me during the ceremony and I couldn‚Äôt help but smile every time I looked at him
story_texts: When I‚Äôm attracted to someone I tend to flirt really hard. My ways of flirting have actually become a part of my daily routine. But people know that if I don‚Äôt go up and start talking to a guy I like then they know my feelings for him are real; This past weekend I went to a wedding. I wore heels and a short dress. That night at the reception I saw this guy that sat near me during the ceremony and I couldn‚Äôt help but smile every time I looked at him; Finally they started playing good music the kind u could actually dance too. I got up and started dancing. After the song ended I walked off stage to go get a drink. I noticed that guy was up there dancing doing his little thing; I finally got the guts to even dance beside him. A slow song came on and we were both standing there so awkwardly. I turned and asked if he wanted to dance. He put the biggest smile on his face and said yes; I couldn‚Äôt help but smile the whole time bc this guy was actually taller than me. I mean 6‚Äô3‚Äù tall. We danced some more then he asked me to slow dance again and by the third slow song it became a mutual agreement to slow dance with each other; After a few more songs I pulled him off the dance floor to take pictures. His family started yelling with excitement for him. We laughed and took pictures; Afterwards I grabbed his hand to pull him towards my family before I knew it he intertwined his fingers with mine. His hugs were great. Later he asked me for my number and I said yes. Come to find out he‚Äôs across the U.S.; I didn‚Äôt know that night became the best night of my life. Even tho we only talked for a day he‚Äôs still really important to me and I wish he knew just how much he made me happy that night.

title: Not the right pronoun

I try to stop him and tell him that it's not ok, but my dad does it too. ; My brother bullies me and tells me I'm not "Good" enough or I'm not "thin" enough... He's been telling me things like this for almost 7 years now.; It hurts and I feel useless a lot of the time. But I've been trying to work on my self-esteem and my confidence and I know now that what people say isn't important and that I should just be me no matter what.

title: Don't be intimidated
lede: I didn‚Äôt want to lose my virginity to him. He kept pressuring me about it.
story_texts: When I was in 10th grade in high school, this boy I was dating wanted to have sex with me. Now I know it‚Äôs normal for teens to be all in their hormones but I just wasn‚Äôt ready at that time; I also knew I didn‚Äôt want to lose my virginity to him. He kept pressuring me about it. Eventually he started asking to come over to my house and I said yes. Of course I wanted to hang out with him but he kept pressing for sex.; I felt disgusted, I wondered if that‚Äôs how people saw me as someone who‚Äôs ‚Äúeasy‚Äù. I also felt aggravated because he wasn‚Äôt listening to me. It seemed like that‚Äôs all he cared about, not about me or my feelings.; I said no multiple times. He reacted in a calm way, he said he understood and that he wishes I could trust him. So I thought okay, maybe he does understand how I feel.; At first, I thought it was a healthy reaction. However, when we got back to school I realized he had been telling everyone we had sex. Even though I‚Äôd deny it. No one seemed to believe me only him.; I wanted me to be able to trust him. But I when found out he was spreading rumors and tried to make himself look good....; It was and is important to say no because you matter. You are an individual with feelings, family, friends, dreams, likes and dislikes. You are important and deserve the right to say yes or no. You can make up your mind and don‚Äôt worry about what the other person might say; In my case, the result of me saying no to him showed me how low of a person he was. And for him to spread rumors, it showed me that he was in my life to try to bring me down.; But that‚Äôs okay because at the end of the day i know the truth. So don‚Äôt ever feel intimidated.

title: BLANK enough

story_texts: I‚Äôm not straight enough. I‚Äôm not gay enough; I‚Äôm a 13 year old gay dude and I‚Äôm not super gay. But I‚Äôm not super straight; I love makeup. I love video games. I hate sports I love swimming;  People never understand it‚Äôs ok not to like what conforms to you. My label doesn‚Äôt define what I like. It only defines who I like.
link_title: Being Female, Male, Transgender or Fluid

title: The test
lede: But if i am pregnant, i‚Äôll figure out a way to deal with it in the way that‚Äôs best for me.
story_texts: I‚Äôm so scared that i‚Äôm pregnant. I‚Äôve felt funny ever since my boyfriend visited 3 weeks ago; We‚Äôre long distance, so when he does visit for those few days we get... busy; I'm on the pill so I don‚Äôt worry too much about protection (and it was right before my period) as long as he doesn‚Äôt finish in me. But the chance is always there.; can‚Äôt take a test yet, but i told myself to calm down and understand that whatever happens, happens, and there‚Äôs nothing i can do to change the results; The chances are low, but if i am pregnant, i‚Äôll figure out a way to deal with it in the way that‚Äôs best for me.; I used pregnancy websites, the support of my boyfriend, comparing my body‚Äôs feelings with similar ones online as resources but honestly next time...100% use protection. it‚Äôs not worth being scared over it
link_title: I think I‚Äôm pregnant. Now what?

title: Dumb drama

story_texts: My ex broke up with me because of dumb a** drama right?; n i knew it was true but i was too love struck to see it. so i begged him for a second chance and he said no; i automatically thought i wasn‚Äôt pretty and funny enough because he went STRAIGHT BACK TO HIS EX that he claimed he HATED while we were dating for a full damn year; but i have given up on this fool because i‚Äôve got me a man who respects me and doesn‚Äôt lie to me

story_texts: Me and my boyfriend had talked about kissing before and said we were both cool about it. Both of us had never kissed anyone before.;  So on our 3 month anniversary we were in his basement on his couch eating Chick-fil-A and he said ‚ÄúYou know what would make that sauce taste even better? Eating it off of your lips‚Äù.; It was a really good kiss. And it definitely tasted betterüòÇ; Every since then we always say ‚ÄúDo you want some sauce‚Äù

title: Manly enough

story_texts: People at my school and even online have told me that I‚Äôm not manly enough or I‚Äôm never going to be a full man; But I don‚Äôt let them get to me cause I know I‚Äôm manly enough; I love who I am
