lede: I am lucky that I had my mother, brother and therapist to help get me through this
story_texts: This is about my relationship with my father.  Ever since I can remember, he has been neglecting me.  He loved to play "favorites" with his children causing a lot of fighting between me and my sister.  We were both fight for his attention all of the time. ; I tried my hardest to be the best I can in school and even picked up basketball.  He was pleased with these things and would often post things on Facebook saying how great I was despite the fact that he never came to any of my games or never took me to practice.; Eventually I grew tired of doing all of these things that I hate just for him.  I figured if he really loved me, he would accept me for who I am, not for what he can show off about me.  He didn't respond well to this.  ; He would often corner me in my room and proceed to talk and sometime yell about how much of a disappointment I was for him.  At that point I was done with him.  I couldn't deal with him anymore.  I lost all hope in thinking he would change.  I decided not to follow the custody order anymore.; I am staying with my mom 100% of the time.  I do not regret that decision at all.  I am lucky that I had my mother, brother and therapist to help get me through this.  I finally realized how strong my mother was to deal with someone like that for so many years.  ; My mom has always been there for me and has never asked anything in return.  She has always been loving and respectful always giving her all to solve any problem we might have.  I work hard so that someday I could be half as selfless as my mother.

title: Practice first
lede: I wrote a little speech and everything and practiced it on her
story_texts: In middle school, the first person I came out to was my advisor; Sometimes I feel bad that I didn't tell my mom or dad first but I really needed help on how to do it; My advisor helped me; I wrote a little speech and everything and practiced it on her; She was so great, no judging, and she's not even gay; I told my sister next and then my parents.  My parents took it hard but their good now.  All in all, I think I was pretty lucky

title: Texting not talking
lede: It was so lame like can't you just talk to me?
story_texts: When I was in middle school, my girlfriend broke up with me over texting; It was so lame like can't you just talk to me?; Anyway, I think I get it now because she didn't know what to say;  It was still lame
link_title: Ten worst ways to break up

title: Counting calories
lede: I hardly ever get good stuff like chips and dessert
story_texts: My mom is really weird about food; She like counts every calorie and now she's counting mine; It really bugs me; I hardly ever get good stuff like chips and dessert; I know that stuff isn't good for you but I'd like it every once in awhile, right?; I wish she would back off
link_title: How much food should I eat?

title: Car rides with dad
lede: But talking about that kind of stuff, especially with my dad, was just awkward.
story_texts: When I was in 5th grade, my dad and I were driving in a car.  We weren‚Äôt really saying anything until he blurts out, ‚ÄúSo, do you have a crush on anyone?‚Äù; And being a preteen girl, I did.  But talking about that kind of stuff, especially with my dad, was just awkward.  ; So, I made him guess, this way I didn‚Äôt have to say my crushes name out loud.  And my dad would know that he should stop getting into my business. ; What I learned from this was, yes, it‚Äôs annoying to have your parents always up in your business, especially about crushes.  ; But at the same time, it is just good to be open and put your trust, even with your deepest secrets in the hands of your parents.
link_title: Talking to your parents -- or other adults

title: Gossip
lede: They even said I changed the way I dressed to "attract" him
story_texts: Last year I got gossiped about; People thought I liked this boy whose a grade higher; They even said I changed the way I dressed to "attract" him.  I didn't! ; I was just trying out a new look and it didn't have anything to do with him; I used to talk to him as a friend but now I don't even say hi; It's really kinda sad because we were friends
link_title: Someone is spreading rumors about me.  What can I do?

title: Caught
lede: I know a kid called the house in the middle of the night cause they were worried she drank too much
story_texts: Last year my older sister whose 16 got caught drinking at a drinking party; It was a big deal; Our parents were pissed; I'm not sure about the whole story but I know a kid called the house in the middle of the night cause they were worried she drank too much; My dad went and got her and he was really mad at her and the parents of the kid who was having the party; I got sent to a friends house the next day so they could talk.  I think things are better now.  But I still worry about my sister

title: Looks
lede: Every morning I change at least 3 times
story_texts: Not knowing what to wear is so, so, so, so hard because you want to look good but look like you didn't try so hard; I‚Äôm really into my looks and sometimes too worried about what other people will think; One morning I went through 15 different outfits until I found the perfect thing; Every morning I change at least 3 times

title: Unlikely confidante
lede: At the time I was very worried about him but it was like all the pressure was on me
story_texts: Back in middle school, I knew this boy who I was kinda off and on with; Sometimes we were friends and other times we just didn‚Äôt really make an effort to talk to each other; Toward the end of the year he began talking to me about how he was depressed; Of all the times, he turns to me for help.  I told him I would get him help.  At the time I was very worried about him but it was like all the pressure was on me; It was hard telling him I was worried about him, but now, to this day, he is getting help

title: I thought we broke up
lede: I told them I didn‚Äôt want to talk because we were broken up
story_texts: I was in a relationship a couple of years ago and one day that person texted me saying they wanted to break-up;  I was confused why but I replied sadly, ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù; About a day later, they texted me again like everything was normal.  I told them I didn‚Äôt want to talk because we were broken up; They kept texting me urgently and expressing messages of self-deprecation; Eventually, my parents had to intervene and everything turned out ok in the end; I was confused about it, but talking with my parents really helped me get through it and I still appreciate the help they gave me

title: New school, new year
lede: And just like that, I wasn‚Äôt getting along with multiple people
story_texts: At the start, things were going well for me.; I was making friends with people new to my school.  I felt I was going to have a great year; Eventually, I wasn‚Äôt getting along with another person; And just like that, I wasn‚Äôt getting along with multiple people; I felt like they were judging me for hanging out with certain people; My chance at a fresh start might have been over.  I still tried to stay positive. I worked hard in school and tried my best to ignore all the negativity thrown toward me.
link_title: When you're the new kid in school

title: No, no, no
lede: He asked me out once, and I said no
story_texts: When I was 10 or 11, a guy in my class had a really big crush on me; I didn't like him back at all; He asked me out once, and I said no; He continued to like me even after I said no; The year after that, he asked me out again. I said no again; He started hating me after that
link_title: How to Say No When Someone Asks You Out

title: Maturity, please
lede: I tend to like people that are older
story_texts: I tend to like people that are older.  I‚Äôm not saying like 10 years older, just a little; Both of my past relationships have been with people around a year older than me; Just the idea of dating someone younger than me seems strange; It probably has something to do with my maturity level; I tend to be attracted to maturity; Maybe in the future I will date someone younger, but that doesn‚Äôt seem super likely
link_title: 6 Questions To Ask Yourself Before Dating An Older Guy

title: Secret signals
lede: I was on my period and tried to signal my mother that I needed pads
story_texts: A couple of years ago, my family went out to dinner; I was on my period and tried to signal my mother that I needed pads; My brother asked what we were talking about; My mother quickly said that I needed shampoo; Right after she said that, my brother asked if we were really going to get pads; I was so embarrassed but in the end it didn‚Äôt matter

title: Worried friend
lede: She used to see a therapist but now doesn't want to again
story_texts: I have a friend who is dealing with depression and anxiety.  She used to see a therapist but now doesn't want to again because she would feel bad about making her parents pay for it; She has recently been feeling a lack of motivation, and she has been having panic attacks with seemingly no trigger; She can't talk to her parents because 1.) they won't understand or 2.) it will worry them and she doesn't want to burden them; I'm worried about her because she has a lot of the same stresses as me, but it is reluctant to seek professional help.  I am worried that if she doesn't, it could keep getting worse; Therapy for me has been incredibly helpful.  It changed my life, but for her it has not been a good experience.  I talked to my own therapist about her, and we agreed that my friend should seek out help, but she is still reluctant to do so; I know from experience how hard it can get if you don't reach out an adult who can really help you

title: Period...not poop
lede: I thought I had pooped my pants
story_texts: When I was 12 years old, I was at sleep-away camp for a month; One night I woke up and went to the bathroom; When I looked in my underwear, I thought I had pooped my pants...I started freaking out and called my best friend into the bathroom; When I was on the brink of crying, she told me that I had gotten my period; The nurse and my counselors helped me get everything I needed and I got to call my mom; The next day they threw me and another girl a Red Party to celebrate our periods
link_title: This Girl's Family Celebrated Her First Period With a Surprise Party

title: Makeup, please
lede: I had wanted to wear makeup for a really long time but I was scared my mom would say no
story_texts: I had wanted to wear makeup for a really long time but I was scared my mom would say no, so I just watched YouTube videos about it; Finally I just asked her if I could wear makeup.  she said, "Yeah, sure." I was really surprised; When we went shopping, we got a few really tinted foundations, lipsticks and face moisturizers; I liked it, but I wanted more coverage even though my face was pretty even...I'd go to the store and buy makeup with high coverage and she got a little upset, but I liked it; The only time I don't wear makeup is if I'm swimming or if I'm playing soccer; I'm trapped in a cycle where I want to look nice, so I wear makeup, but that makeup makes me look bad, so I use more make up to make me look nice
link_title: Why You Should (& Shouldn't) Wear Makeup

title: Friends again
lede: Before her diagnosis she was happiest, healthiest, most confident and beautiful girl I knew
story_texts: Last summer, my oldest sister was diagnosed with severe anorexia; She had a boyfriend at the time; it was sophomore year and they had been together since before 8th grade. She was extremely skinny, pale, and not confident at all; Before her diagnosis she was happiest, healthiest, most confident and beautiful girl I knew. Over that one summer, she went from all of that to being hospitalized and extremely depressed; He ended up breaking up with her during the hardest thing she had ever faced, and his reason was that she "wasn‚Äôt confident enough anymore."; A few days after that, she was hospitalized  again and stayed there for two and a half months, and returned back to school without her best friend and boyfriend to help her get better and be happier; He and my sister are now friends again and spend time together but are no longer romantic, but for a while, I was so angry at him for hurting my sister
link_title: 4 Ways to Be a Good Friend During a Friend's Breakup

title: Official
lede: I decided we were better off as friends
story_texts: In 8th grade I liked this boy; We lived in the same neighborhood; So we decided to meet up...it was over Winter Break and it had just snowed. We met by a pond at a gazebo. I had a lot of fun walking around and throwing snow at each other; We met three times over break and then we made it official after a week or so.  I just found out that he was going to buy me a pair of shoes; At the end of February, I decided we were better off as friends; It was after Valentine‚Äôs Day and not before his birthday

title: Light
lede: I‚Äôm sometimes wishing I weighed more but it‚Äôs O.K.
story_texts: Uhhh, O.K.; So basically I weigh 90 lbs. I‚Äôm light; I kinda like it. It makes me nimble; I‚Äôm sometimes wishing I weighed more but it‚Äôs O.K.; Weird genetics; Late bloomer
link_title: What's the Right Weight for My Height

title: Dysfunction
lede: We would always fight and everyone was mean to me
story_texts: When I was younger, I was in a really dysfunctional friend group; We would always fight and everyone was mean to me; My older sister and her friends were always super nice to me and I always felt like a better fit in their friendship group.  They accepted me, and it felt good to have some actual friends; I left my old friends and had a great year with my sister and our friends; The next year my sister and our friends were in high school and I was stuck in middle school; I don't have many friends now because my old friends don't talk to me.  Most of my high school friends treat me like a little kid

title: Practice makes better
lede: I practiced the break up
story_texts: In 8th grade I wanted to break up with my boyfriend at the time; So for 24 hours I practiced the break up; I wrote several speeches, I preached in the mirror, and I practiced on my mother; I did everything except actually break up with him.  the next day I told him I wanted to break up.  I used one of my speeches; It went really well.  It felt really healthy; We both left the conversation feeling good about our relationship.  We still occasionally chat to this day

title: Black shorts needed
lede: When I got my first period, I was at camp during the summer
story_texts: When I got my first period, I was at camp during the summer; I was wearing white shorts the first day, so that wasn‚Äôt very fun; I spent the whole week with cramps, black shorts, and a bag full of pads
link_title: How Can You Make Sure Your Period Won‚Äôt Leak Onto Your Clothes?

title: Not pregnant
lede: It had been over a month without a period
story_texts: This summer, at camp, a friend was walking with me about our home life, and she talked to me about the guys she has had sex with; She mentioned that it was 4 weeks since she had gotten her period; That's when we started to get worried; It had been over a month without a period after what she said was unprotected sex, and she gets regular periods; Another week passed and nothing happened.  We got so worried, we told a counselor who got her a pregnancy test; She took the test but thankfully it revealed she wasn't pregnant

title: Firsts
lede: It was both our first kiss
story_texts: My first kiss was when I was 13 years old; It was at a middle school dance; It was while we were in the middle of slow dancing and we kissed; It was both our first kiss; We hugged right after and then the song stopped

title: Fear of models
lede: I love my body and wouldn't change anything, but sometimes I have doubts
story_texts: When I was very little, I had a fear of the models in shampoo commercials, with their ‚Äúperfect‚Äù bodies and hair; I hated those people, and I was constantly terrified that I would grow up to look like that; I‚Äôm comfortable in my own body; Sometimes though, very rarely, I'll feel bad about my how my body looks in a certain outfit or something; I love my body and wouldn't change anything, but sometimes I have doubts; I have been told that I need to change my body once or twice, but I know I never dislike how I look

title: Snuggle buddies
lede: I often felt as though I was interrupting something private
story_texts: Freshmen year there was a couple in my friend group and they were always very affectionate; At lunch when my friends were hanging out, they would snuggle, and I often felt as though I was interrupting something private even though the rest of us were trying to talk and have fun at lunch; One of my friends or I would usually good-naturedly ask them to stop; When I was alone with them and felt like a third wheel, I would just go hang out with someone else

title: Drama
lede: She insults me about the little things
story_texts: Every time we see each other our interactions are fake.  I think we both know that but we choose to not start any drama. It‚Äôs getting worse though.  ; She insults me about the little things, making me feel embarrassed, insecure, or mad. ; In front of people too, which makes it worse.  I‚Äôm trapped because I see her almost every class period and I sit at her table too.; It‚Äôs always awkward when we are alone, and I try to be nice to her, but one of these days I won‚Äôt be able to keep my feelings bottled up.; I just hate drama so I stay away from it.; This classmate makes that goal hard.

title: First time
lede: Over time, I have gotten more efficient
story_texts: When I was 13, I shaved for the first time,  It was really hard to make sure I didn‚Äôt miss any patches; I always had to go back, and it took me 30 minutes to finish; Over time, I have gotten more efficient; Now it is easy to shave in the morning before school

title: Not interested
lede: I had no interest in him at all
story_texts: In eighth grade there was a boy who liked me; I had no interest in him at all; We didn‚Äôt talk daily, but we would have a conversation occasionally. Sometimes he would joke around with me or trip me on purpose; So one day before going home, a couple of boys came up to me and asked if I would say yes if he asked me out.  That moment I started freaking out, he just wasn‚Äôt somebody that I was interested in; I was kinda freaking out because I didn‚Äôt know what to do, and I almost felt like it made me look bad.  He definitely got the message that I didn‚Äôt want to go out with him; I felt bad and apologized later.  On the last day, he told me not to do that to another guy, so now I feel bad

title: Growing pains
lede: Suddenly during middle of the year I started feeling growing pains
story_texts: I was 4'9" and I was really short and pudgy; Suddenly during middle of the year I started feeling growing pains; I played sports often and did not stretch; That is one of the reasons why I was hurting; By the end of 8th grade year, I was 5'4" and the growing pains got better; Key advice:  stretch and sleep well and you will be better

title: Pool time
lede: I still didn‚Äôt know how to put in a tampon
story_texts: Maybe the 4th or 5th time I got my period, I still didn‚Äôt know how to put in a tampon; I had tried before but I was never able to do it for some reason; It wasn‚Äôt really urgent, so I just didn‚Äôt deal with it; Then one morning, I woke up a realized I had my period again, but I had a lesson in a pool in a couple of hours; So I went to my mom and was like, ‚ÄúWhat in the heck do I do???‚Äù; She looked up a video on what to do, and I was able to figure it out in time for my lesson
link_title: Period hygiene: tampons, pads and menstrual cups

title: Wrong size
lede: I thought there was only one size of bras - A
story_texts: I have 2 dads so growing up they didn‚Äôt always provide me with girl information due to their lack of knowledge; In middle school when my chest started to develope faster and more than anyone else, I thought I was abnormal because I thought there was only one size of bras - A; Up until the beginning of 8th grade, I wore size A even though in reality I was 3 or 4 sizes bigger; Eventually my best friend told me my bra was the wrong size and proceeded to take me bra shopping; Throughout the years she has been the one to help me with bra shopping, wearing a bikini, using deodorant, and putting in a tampon

title: Bacne
lede: I have done everything to try and get rid of it
story_texts: When I was 12 I start to get acne (face, neck, chest and back); At first, I didn‚Äôt really think about it and I thought it would just go away, but then it started to get worse and worse; I did everything to get rid of it; It was painful and I felt really alone because only a few people I knew had it, and it would come and go; I have done everything to try and get rid of it, but it would always come back.  I wear clothes that cover my acne and I wear my hair in a ponytail so it will hide it for me; It‚Äôs really difficult because I am always thinking about it -- what clothes to wear so it won‚Äôt show.  And having to deal with it constantly, and having it hurt, and having it give me headaches
link_title: Dealing With Acne: Is It Time To See A Dermatologist?

title: Waiting
lede: In 7th and 8th grade I used to joke about my shortness
story_texts: I have always been short; People have been saying for 5 years I‚Äôll hit my growth spurt soon; I‚Äôve just gotten used to the idea that I won‚Äôt; In 7th and 8th grade I used to joke about my shortness, probably to bring attention to it and ease the stress with a laugh; Other people followed suit, and it helped me realize that height really doesn‚Äôt matter
link_title: Feeling Too Tall or Too Short

title: Privacy, please
lede: I still didn‚Äôt like them looking through my stuff without my permission
story_texts: One time I walked into my room after practice; My mom and sister were looking all around my room; They said they were looking for speakers but I still didn‚Äôt like them looking through my stuff without my permission
link_title: My Parents Won't Respect My Privacy

title: Overnight
lede: I feel like I got breasts overnight
story_texts: I feel like I got breasts overnight; When I was in a store with my family, my chest started to hurt; When I got to the car at the end of the day, I looked at my chest and my breast had grown; A LOT! ; I started to cry because I thought it was breast cancer

title: Testy testosterone
lede: I can feel it sometimes giving me strength I didn‚Äôt know I had
story_texts: Part of growing up as a teenage boy is learning to deal with testosterone;  I can feel it sometimes giving me strength I didn‚Äôt know I had; It‚Äôs also part of the reason teenage boys do stupid things; Sometimes, I have some sort of strange urges to do some stupid stunt I know won‚Äôt end well
link_title: Top Signs You Are a Boy in Puberty

title: Sister woes
lede: We get along a little bit, but most of the time it is short lived
story_texts: My sister constantly annoys me and when I fight back, she cries and blames it on me; Even though it is my fault sometimes, she always tries to start a fight; We get along a little bit, but most of the time it is short lived

story_texts: When I was 11, me and this girl were kinda flirting with each other and at the end of the school year she confronted me about it; We emailed over the summer; When we got back to school, we broke up and it wasn‚Äôt anything too special

title: Bones
lede: I struggle with weight more than other people my age
story_texts: The way my bones are made, I weigh a lot more than most people.; I struggle with weight more than other people my age; 140 lbs; I have accepted it now but it was hard

title: "Accident"
lede: I remember a time when my girlfriend kissed another girl in front of me
story_texts: When I was in my first relationship, I remember a time when my girlfriend kissed another girl in front of me; I knew it was an ‚Äúaccident‚Äù but it still hurt; The girl was a grade above me and hung out with my girlfriend a lot; When I talked to my friends about it, they told me she was cheating, but I didn‚Äôt want to believe them; To this day I am still not sure what was really going on, but I knew it hurt; The moral is if you feel uncomfortable in a relationship, don‚Äôt be afraid to put your feelings in words or even end it

title: Broken voice
lede: My voice was so low, my mom thought there was a robber in the house
story_texts: One day I couldn‚Äôt speak at all and my voice was completely broken; The next day my voice was so low, my mom thought there was a robber in the house; It was super surprising for me because as far as i knew, voice changes were supposed to  happen over a long period of time; Guess it happened fast for me

title: Shaving 101

story_texts: I remember when I finally asked my mom how to shave, and when I did I was so happy when I realized just how dry and smooth your legs get after you shave; It was weird; And putting on deodorant was weird too; Shaving your armpits can cut you, so you have to pay attention when you do it

title: Worried
lede: It's not just girls who worry about their weight
story_texts: I‚Äôve never felt secure in my own body.; I‚Äôve always been overweight and bigger than everyone else; I don‚Äôt eat some days because I‚Äôm worried too fat even though I shouldn't do that; It's not just girls who worry about their weight

title: Breast buds not best buds
lede: Guys have breast buds too
story_texts: Once I had things behind my nipples, and they really hurt; My older brother had the same thing before me; My brother asked my mom; My mom had to look it up and she said it was normal; Guys have breast buds too; He was relieved because he thought it was cancer

title: Snapchat woes
lede: She felt some type of way abt the post
story_texts: I Lost One Of My Close Friends Due To Something I Posted On Snapchat; She Felt Some Type Of Way Abt The Post But I Tried To Tell Her It Wasn't Directed To Her; But She Didn't Believe Me So We Went Our Seperate Ways; I Felt Sad Because She Was My Friend And I Really Didnt Think She Would Have Took It Like That Even Though It Wasn't Directed To Her; I Learned That You Shouldn't Post Certain Things, You Should Keep Them To Yourself Because You Never Know Who You Might Hurt

title: A million pounds lighter
lede: I'm not good at talking in person
story_texts: Recently me and a good friend just decided we didn't want to be best friends anymore; So as all my friends know I'm not good at talking in person because I can't express words so I was able to communicate through texting which was good; I told that I hoped we could still treat each other with kindness and she told me what happened and why she was thinking the same thing ; We worked it out and now we're able to talk to each other kindly and still not be friends; It felt amazing to be able to not have to look into someone's eyes and say all that üòÇ ; And I felt like a million pounds had just been lifted off my chest
link_title: How to handle a friend breakup

title: Stereotypical teenagers
lede: it's not realistic, and it's also not healthy to share this message
story_texts: The people in the movies are always stereotypical teenagers; You need to be perfect to get a boyfriend or girlfriend; This is so bad; It's not realistic, and it's also not healthy to share this message with future generation to believe; I always try to look past this message, but it's always lingering out there

title: Assumptions
lede: I automatically assume that all couples are happy
story_texts: movie couples tend to fall in love at first sight; in a lot of movies, the message is that all couples are really happy and in love right after meeting; it's makes you feel like your relationships might not be valid if they aren't always happy; I automatically assume that all couples are happy

title: Diverse movies needed
lede: I've never seen a movie with the focus on a same-sex relationship
story_texts: Movies seem to often show relationships as either really easy and magical, or as poor things with nasty breakups. There's no middle ground-no calm quiet breakups, no just healthy, decent relationships, they always seem to be spectacular.; In probably the majority of movies with romance I've seen, the relationships are based a lot on appearance; Often between a really skinny, model-type woman and a handsome man; I've never seen a movie with the focus on a same-sex relationship; This always kinda annoys me, like why can't movies have at least a little more diversity? Everyone's different, and it never shows in a lot of those romances; I make sure movies like that don't impact how I think of relationships-perfect appearances and simple romances aren't reality, and I know it.

title: Disney isn't real
lede: Disney is fake
story_texts: Disney is fake; I watched twilight and I thot the guys were hot; But like not all guys can look like that ; So I think it's bad that guys and girls have that high standard ; bc not all ppl can look like that

title: Joking but not
lede: I feel guilty because I think I'm developing feelings all over again for her
story_texts: My best friend is a pansexual gender fluid and has a girlfriend currently. Now the thing is, I have a girlfriend also (I identify as a pansexual female); I was with my best friend last night alone....and I don't know....I feel guilty because I think I'm developing feelings all over again for her....; More so that she's telling me that she's having problems with her relationship and how she's barely in one and how her gf never talks to her anymore, and how she's gonna break up with her in the summer because she doesn't know how right now, and how she feels more comfortable talking to me...; I feel like a shitty girlfriend to my girlfriend because I was texting her back (my gf knew I was with her) saying things like "I'm sorry babe but I'm cheating on you" and my best friend also did the same to her girlfriend....; It's a joke but, somehow it feels like more but not quite....; Like we almost kissed but she backed out before I did but we both laughed and said it was a joke and I just don't know anymore
link_title: A crash course in gender & gender identity

title: Hair, hair, everywhere
lede: Honestly, most of these changes are annoying
story_texts: I have noticed changes about pubic hair, hair growing in other places, and in my penis.; I think i might have went through puberty earlier than people my age.; I think that because I don't necessarily remember when my puberty started but I know it was a few years ago.; Honestly, most of these changes are annoying and I wish they would go away already but I know that it's a part if growing up so I'll just have to deal with it.

title: Everyone goes through it
lede: Some changes are good but most are just a pain in the butt
story_texts: I have gotten a lot of bumps. Also I have gotten taller, sadly. Hair has grown in places. My boobs are hurting.; I have this weird gunk in my panties. It's sticky and gooey and it ruins my underwear.; I think I have gone through puberty later because I don't have boobs like the other girls and bumps all over my face.; I think that I couldn't relate to the girls getting there periods in 5 and 6 grade.; Some changes are good but most are just a pain in the butt but every girl goes through it so I'm not in it alone.

title: Don't touch
lede: I don't like people touching me
story_texts: So their was this boy and he was a player and I didn't know cause I was new to the school. So he tried and tried and then he touched me and it got really awkward because I don't like people touching me.; So I yelled at him to never touch me again; He reacted really well to the situation and immediately stopped; So now we are best friends and we love each other in a friendly way

title: Relieved
lede: He told my best friend who was a girl that he liked me
story_texts: There was a guy friend that I became real close with and started to have feelings for; He told my best friend who was a girl that he liked me and told her to ask me if I liked him; When she told him I liked him too he was happy and didn't know what to do; This was good and a healthy reaction; I talked to him about it and it was kind of a relief

title: Friend to more than friend
lede: She had thought that I liked her in a different way (and I did)
story_texts: This person was Shamiah and she was special to me because she was nice to me. And she is my best friend.; I told her that she was a very good friend to me and that I know that I can always count on her.; She had thought that I liked her in a different way. (And I did); This was a healthy reaction because she said that she liked me like that too.; I felt good because I was smiling the whole day.

title: Weird and normal
lede: My tits are huge and inconvenient
story_texts: my tits are huge and inconvenient and i cant run anymore and also like 3/4 weeks of the month i feel like crap; i started getting tits at 8 so i'm pretty sure this was really early; I feel weird and insecure but also like its normal so...; i'm going to keep doing me and trust that my body will develop as it should

title: Shy
lede: My curves are getting bigger
story_texts: My curves are getting bigger, and while that is great, I'm getting noticed for it and I'm more of a shy person.; I think I am going through puberty at the same time as my friends, which helps because everyone else is changing too.; Because it helps me go trough puberty when everyone else is so that you don't feel alone.; They make me feel confident about myself,  like I'm coming out of my shell a little more each week.

title: Shock
lede: Asked her did she want to go out she said yes
story_texts: I met Monique in school; I heard she liked me and I texted her and she said "not all wishes come true." ; Asked her did she want to go out she said yes; I was shocked since it had been 3 years since I dated anyone; This was a healthy interaction since I told her how I felt and she did the same; I was happy
link_title: 8 Ways To Tell Your Crush You Like Them If You‚Äôre Shy

title: My secret
lede: I try to tell them but I always say nevermind
story_texts: Am not gonna tell who but they are special to me because they have the best personality and they remind me of myself ; they are funny calm and outgoing I get flustered whenever am around them; I didn't really tell them yet cuz I'm too scared to ; I try to tell them but I always say nevermind; I really wanna tell him in person one day instead of by text so I can see his reaction; He really makes me flustered though so i'll need to work on that

title: Everyone else...and then me
lede: Everyone seems so on top of their health and routines and I am DEFINITELY not
story_texts: Well, my period cramps are so severe I have to get medication from the doctor.; It makes me break out all along my forehead.; i am going through puberty a little later, but for the most part I am on track; Everyone seems so on top of their health and routines and I am DEFINITELY not; The cramps suck because they make me cry but the acne on my forehead makes me extremely self-conscious; I've heard that there are face washes that I'll try to make my skin less oily so imma gonna try that

title: Gym accident
lede: I told her I bled through my pants on my period
story_texts: This person was my best friend (my girlfriend now); I told her I bled through my pants on my period; She laughed at me for a while before she went to get me my gym pants and a tampon; I think her reaction was pretty healthy because she actually apologized for it later and hasn't done anything like that since (laugh at me I mean.); It was nice. I enjoy having a relationship where I can talk to her
link_title: What can I expect when I get my period?

title: Teens these days
lede: I'm constantly in my head and worrying about what others think
story_texts: My voice got deeper, I started to grow hair everywhere, and some stuff happened to my sex organ; I think I went through puberty at the same time as people my age; These changes make me feel more mature and a lot more self confident; Even though on the inside I'm constantly in my head and worrying about what others think; Smh guess this is how being a teen is these days
link_title: Top signs boys are in puberty

title: Help
lede: I'm glad that he talked to me but I want to make sure that he talks to someone else who can get him help
story_texts: My boyfriend was depressed and told me he was suicidal. We spent that entire day on the phone, talking about something completely unrelated and at around 2am he told me I changed his mind; Because we didn't live close together, we had a conversation instead of physically touching one another; After, his problem was solved... for the time being. And he became much happier; I felt happily terrified. I'm glad that he talked to me but I want to make sure that he talks to someone else who can get him help

title: Still friends
lede: To be honest, i was kind if heart broken but also relieved
story_texts: This person was my girlfriend at my other school and she was special to me because we were togther for a very long time.; I didnt tell them anything except when they said that they wanted to break up with me and I said that if that's how you feel then i guess i cant do anything about it.; They reacted by just explaining the way they felt about us and decided that we could still be friends.; This was a healthy reaction because i knew that it would have been to hard for either of us to not talk to each other; To be honest, i was kind if heart broken but also relieved that it wasn't because of anything that i had done.

title: Friends to more than friends
lede: I did not want to ruin our friendship if the feeling was not reciprocated.
story_texts: My long time best friend -- a year at least. I had always confided in her; she meant a lot to me. While we were friends I had dated a couple other people, but the relationships never really felt right. She was always there for me. I could trust her with everything.; I told her that I wanted to be more than friends. I did this very cautiously. I did not want to ruin our friendship if the feeling was not reciprocated.; She reacted by having her friend tell me her answer. The answer was that she had liked me too. It was an extremely overwhelming feeling of happiness for both of us.; This was a healthy reaction. We both came out happy.; I felt refreshed and calm. I felt like a weight had been lifted off of my shoulders.

title: Mom doesn't always know best
lede: I can't help the way I feel
story_texts: I was talking to my wondrous loving mother; I was trying to come out as bisexual to her; She told me I was too young to know and that if I was bisexual I would know it later on; She then proceeded to tell me that I shouldn't want to be bisexual because they have commitment issues; I can't help the way I feel and thought that my mom's reaction was unhealthy as hell; I felt crappy, uncomfortable, sad, and misunderstood.
link_title: Telling people your sexual orientation -- or not

title: Decisions, decisions
lede: Well I didn't tell him yet but my ex girlfriend wants to get back together but I can't unless I stop messing around with him
story_texts: Dan is a friends with benefits; Well I didn't tell him yet but my ex girlfriend wants to get back together but I can't unless I stop messing around with him. I don't know how to tell himüò™; He's a really good friend of mine and I don't want him to be upset ; I want to be honest with him and think that talking to him in person may be too much; I'll text him and tell him we can talk after school on Monday if he wants
link_title: How should I end a relationship?

title: The crush
lede: I am building the courage to tell him and am now less nervous
story_texts: I had an eighth grade crush and we talked about who we liked; I liked him a lot but had never told him; I told him that the person that I liked had a name started with an "A"; They were clueless and shrugged; I am building the courage to tell him and an now less nervous and more comfortable in a way
link_title: Puppy Love Dos and Don'ts for Crushes

title: Confused
lede: I'm confused and don't know how I feel and don't really wanna ask my mom
story_texts: I got hair growing in different places and my menstrual cycle; I think that I'm going through puberty earlier than most; I think that because I hear most girls go through the same things next year or the year after; I'm confused and don't know how I feel and don't really wanna ask my mom; I just know that my body is changing

title: Social media: good or bad?
lede: I do however always feel a pressure to post or not post something
story_texts: Me and a girl I knew from class who weren't great friends started talking on Instagram, a few months later and we're best friends now; I never had a friend like her before so it was a really great feeling.; I do however always feel a pressure to post or not post something. Like you never know how others will react.; When people do get mad or annoyed at something I've posted I feel bad, but sometimes I feel like they need to stop over reacting; I know that people are protective over certain things, and they will say what they want, but sometimes they just need to chill.

title: Distance: who cares?
lede: My best friend and I are kind of platonic partners and, he lives kinda far away.
story_texts: My best friend and I are kind of platonic partners and, he lives kinda far away, but anytime he sees flowers he'll send me pictures of them just because he knows how much I love flowers, and I always send him pictures of the sunset here. It's kinda really great and shows when we're thinking of one another. It's just like a way of saying, today I was thinking about you and, I love you; It makes both of our days; And I'm happiest when we talk; It just makes me happy to know he's happy; When we're both smiling like lunatics at out phones it's kinda great

title: Sometimes
lede: The changes make me feel sometimes uncomfortable with myself but then sometimes I feel good about myself.
story_texts: I seen changes in my body like my chest has grown and when I was younger I was chubby but since I've gotten older i've grown a figure.; I think I have went through puberty earlier than most people because I started my puberty around 11.; My friends and me are close and tell me when they started their cycles or have grown new things so I have compared to mines.; The changes make me feel sometimes uncomfortable with myself but then sometimes I feel good about myself.

title: Replacement friend
lede: My bestfriend replaced me with someone else and made fun of me
story_texts: My bestfriend replaced me with someone else and made fun of me and slammed doors on me when I had a broken foot and was in crutches.; I was angry, sad, and disappointed in her for acting that way and in me for not saying anything; She ignored me for weeks and then all of a sudden wanted to be my friend again; I wanted to just laugh it off and go back to being normal but was still mad about it; So I told her that it made me feel bad when she ignored me and pretended that we weren't friends anymore and replaced me; She apologized and said that she was jealous because I was getting all the attention when i got my foot broken and that she missed me
link_title: 12 Small signs your best friend is a true friend

title: Next time
lede: I just shrugged and walked away but want to think about how to respond next time
story_texts: There are some kids at school; I was hanging out with them because they were the "cool black kids" and everyone says I'm super white but I'm actually mixed. So I get along with them pretty well. ; And then this one time they were talking about homosexuality.; And they were like "thats gross and wrong and you're going to hell."; I felt terrible because I'm bisexual and there's lots of people who say I'm wrong and that I shouldn't be allowed to live; I just shrugged and walked away but want to think about how to respond next time instead of being silent

title: Love is love
lede: Love is love regardless of gender.
story_texts: There's a bunch of kids at school who are considered popular but are really just annoying and immature; They made fun of me for being a lesbian.; Just because I have a girlfriend instead of a boyfriend they got mad; It made me upset and mad but mostly I felt sorry for the people who couldn't see that I'm much happier with a woman than a boy; I told them that there's no reason two women can't love each other. Love is love regardless of gender

title: Seeking guidance
lede: I was really sad. I didn't know what I did to make them be so mean to me.
story_texts: This girl wuz bullying me; Made fun of how I looked, and wasn't being kind to me. I would want to play games or do things during recess and they made fun of what I was doing.; I was really sad. I didn't know what I did to make them be so mean to me.; I kept trying to stand up for myself but they kept making me feel sad and so I talked to my guidance counselor.

title: Don't be scared
lede: I've been off schedule and my period is sometimes late
story_texts: I've had my period for years now and recently I've been off schedule and my period is some times late also I'm scared that something may be off; I think puberty is hitting me a bit late and I think this because most of the teens I hang around with the or pre-teens seem like they've hit puberty and I'm still going through that process; I think that I'm going through puberty later based on my mom because she's told me the same thing happen to her; I'm still scared and worried but know I'm not the only one
link_body: Menstruation ‚Äî aka having your period ‚Äî is when blood and tissue from your uterus comes out of your vagina. It usually happens once every month.

title: Taller and tired
lede: Many people are tired or getting taller or always in their mood about different things
story_texts: I have gotten taller and hit my growth spurt; I have gotten more tired even though I have been getting lots of rest; I'm goin through puberty at the same time as others because I can see many people going through the same thing that I do; Many people are tired or getting taller or always in their mood about different things; It make my feel like I'm not alone because everyone goes through puberty even if they do it at different times
link_body: At puberty, guys' bodies begin producing a lot of the hormone testosterone, which causes changes in several parts of the body, including the voice.

title: Later puberty
lede: I'm flatter than a piece of paper
story_texts: I haven't really started puberty yet even though I'm tall; It'a happening a lot later for me... I'm turning 15 in a couple of months and I still haven't gotten my period; I'm flatter than a piece of paper, but I rarely get zits and I'm 5'8.; I wonder if it's because I'm 98 lbs.; I feel alone but know that others out there are probably in my shoes too
link_body: Many teenage girls experience feelings of disliking their bodies at one point or another.

title: Lowkey hanging
lede: We were lowkey a thing, because we'd always hold hands, cuddle, and go everywhere together
story_texts: Previous marching season, it was my first season ever marching since I'm a freshman. I made first chair, and this boy that I started out disliking was my rival, since we were both the best. Well, we ended up getting close. ; We were lowkey a thing, because we'd always hold hands, cuddle, and go everywhere together. He told my sister that he liked me, and that I was one of the only people he'd cry for if I died.; I told him how I liked him in december, over Christmas break.; He told me that he knows it sucks liking someone and them not liking you back, and then when I told him that I get that he likes someone else he said 'How would you know whether I liked you back or not?'; I'm not sure if the reaction was healthy or not, but I know it confused me.; Even now I still like that boy. We're best friends, and things are still confusing. He gets mad if I call other boys cute and if I walk with other people, and I go over to his house like every other weekend. I just feel clueless, not knowing what we are.

title: Someone to trust
lede: I felt better about it cause its been weighing on me for awhile
story_texts: My girlfriend is special to me because she's been with me most of my life and still is today after 5 years; I told her about the time my dad was in the hospital; She acted in a concerned and understanding way; This was a healthy reaction because she kept asking how I felt and made sure I was ok; I felt better about it cause its been weighing on me me for awhile and I needed to tell someone that I trusted

story_texts: his name was nicky and we broke up? we were never in a relationship but he acted like we were; i told him i was done and he over reacted; he over reacted and called me many mean names and it hurt; This was very unhealthy; At first I felt horrible, but i'm kinda glad it's over, whatever it was

title: No words
lede: I told my parents I was trans...
story_texts: I told my parents I was trans...; They told me I'll never be Oliver. I'll always be Shellie, and I'll always be their baby girl.; I felt terrible in the moment. It made me want to actually DIE.; I didn't say a word, in fact, I didn't speak to my mother for nearly an hour.; I called my coach immediately and he picked up. After telling him everything that happend, I felt much better. He calls me Oliver.

link_body: There are lots of safe and fun ways to explore gender expression while you figure out who you are. So let's have at it!

title: Words hurt
lede: People at school would say i was "too fat" or i had "no ass" and i need to get braces
story_texts: uhh well i was bullied by people at school; people at school would say i was 'too fat' or i had 'no ass' and i need to get braces cause i have 'roller coaster teeth' or i was 'too ugly for anyone to love'; I'd go to my dad but he told me that kids will be kids and that I needed to toughen up; at first it didn't bother me but i started to believe all that they were sayin, i started to think that i was a worthless human being, that i offer nothing to the world; one day i was so sick and tired of feeling this way so i stopped it all; i wanted to stand up to all them and i did, and now i don't see my dad. I don't get bullied anymore

title: Insecurities with puberty
lede: I feel like I started way too early!
story_texts: I've gotten so much acne. I've sprouted out of nowhere! I've been told I look 5+ years older then my age.; Don't even get my started on periods; mine are ten times worse then all of my friends because of family genes and they all think that I'm faking it and being over dramatic! But I literally can't move when cramping.; I started my period when I was 10 years old. 12 years ago. I feel like I started way too early!; I think it's something that just runs through my family but I don't know.; I'm mature for my age, mentally older then all of my friends, and very insecure. It's a roller coaster of emotions. It's both tough and easy. In all kinds of ways.

title: Feeling behind with puberty

story_texts: Literally pubic hair is the absolute worst. But I like how my üçÜ is bigger.; Honestly, I am kinda behind. Most of my friends hit puberty all at once while I started in elementary school.; Everyone has gotten taller and I'm still really short. Also peoples voices are a lot deeper than mine.; To be honest, I like some of the changes. But other ones I could do without.

story_texts: I've noticed that every time before I start the big P my boobs and butt start to hurt fml üòÇ; I think i'm going through puberty at the same time as others my age; because all my friends started around the same year as me.; I feel horrible, especially on days when all I wanna do is eat üç´; I really want to learn how to use a tampon since pads get in the way when I go to swim practice and do other stuff; My sister said she'd teach me soon

title: Starting a relationship
lede: There was this boy, and we both knew that I liked him and he liked me
story_texts: There was this boy, and we both knew that I liked him and he liked me. ; We started spending time together during school and people started shipping us, so we started dating.; I told them that I would be interested in dating him.; They reacted well and said that they would like to date me too.; It was a healthy reaction and we had a healthy relationship for a few months before breaking up.

title: Let's talk
lede: I talked to them and we felt more comfortable with each other
story_texts: This person was named Sheneika and they were special because we had everything in common and that we could talk to to each other about anything.; I told her personal stories of when I get and trouble and when I was feeling bad. I also told them about how myself was changing and how I love her.; This was healthy because we told each other how we felt so we could get to know about each other to get our relationship better.; I talked to them and we felt more comfortable with each other.

title: Misleading texts
lede: He went and found a new girlfriend but still texts me all the time
story_texts: Kevon and I went out for a while and he was special to me because he was my first love; After we broke up I told him that I wanted him back; Then he went and found a new girlfriend but still texts me all the time; This makes me mad and is unhealthy because he keeps leading me on and giving me hope; It makes me sad; I'm gonna stop replying to his DMs

title: Don't compare
lede: I compare myself to others and how they look
story_texts: I have body hair and acne for days!!!!!!!!! and more defined facial features; i'm going through puberty the same time as others; I compare myself to others and how they look, but still everyone is different and I don't know how others are feeling inside; I guess puberty's a part of life. It's not awkward.

title: Transpuberty
lede: I've got more body hair, stupid boobs that I'm gonna get removed anyways
story_texts: I've got more body hair, stupid boobs that I'm gonna get removed anyways (Im Transgender, FTM), the obvious period, facial hair (thankfully, even though I haven't started Testosterone yet)...; my voice dropped (again, thankfully, but strangely) and I've had an increase in horniness; I started going through puberty around age 12, which I think is pretty normal...; Bc everyone said it was; The changes that make me more feminine like boobs growing and having my period make me feel dysphoric and anxious about every move I make, scared that someone will realize I'm Transgender and will start harassing me... ; others like my body hair growing, and my voice dropping make me feel happy because I wanna be recognized as a male

title: Late bloomer
lede: I got my period, and my boobs grew a little bit.
story_texts: I got my period, and my boobs grew a little bit. ; Also I've grown taller and grew hair in some interesting places.; I'm definitely going through puberty later than all my friends since they had boobs back in like 5th grade ; And I'm still smaller than a lot of people who have grown a lot my age.; I don't mind being a little later since I can learn from them bout training bras and stuff; I feel scared and excited.

title: Bottled anger
lede: The people that are bullying me are the people from my school.
story_texts: The people that are bullying me are the people from my school.; They always make fun of how short I am. Every. DAY.; It really makes me feel like a piece of crap tbh.; I don't really say anything tbr.; Sometimes I wanna use my fists or break something cuz I'm so mad; But I know that doesn't actually solve anything and that I need to work on my self confidence

title: Denial
lede: They say I will never be Travis. I will always be Michelle, and I will always be their baby girl.
story_texts: My parents say things that make me feel sad; I'm FTM and tried to tell them a while back; They say I'll never be Travis. I'll always be Michelle, and I'll always be their baby girl.; I told a teacher at school about how my parents weren't talking to me and they said I could always talk to them; My parents are talking to me a little more now but I've been talking to other adults in my life who understand me more
link_body: Transgender people feel that the sex they were assigned at birth doesn‚Äôt match their gender identity.

title: BFF turned frenemy
lede: My crush was dating my best friend
story_texts: My crush was dating my best friend; He always ignored me, like I was never there, all he did was talk to my best friend, aka his girl friend, which made me very uncomfortable.; I got the courage one time to try and make plans, since he said he wanted to, but he blew me off for her and said 'he had to clean the house' but instead his girlfriend, aka my friend posted a picture on instagram about it, and made me feel like I was being targeted by her.; She knew she had something I wanted and could never have, and would rub it in my face when ever she could, always bringing him up in conversations and reading their texts off to me, even when I told her to stop and after awhile I had to hang up.; My sis saw that I was in my head a lot and told me to stop worrying about their pettiness; I've been spending more time with her and other friends and that's been making me feel a lot better
link_body: Bullying can hurt both physically and emotionally. If you have been bullied, don‚Äôt blame yourself.

lede: My parents call me Larry but I've been going by Kandy since 6th grade
story_texts: My parents call me Larry but I've been going by Kandy since 6th grade; My friends call me üç¨ n my teachers too; They even use she/her/hers pronouns with me; Proud to be #transgender
